channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump is greenlighting an Alaska megamine—and taking a government stake in the company digging it up
item.description: While Trump has often said, “drill, baby, drill,” he also supports “mine, baby, mine,” Interior Secretary Doug Burgum said.

item.title: He Was Expected to Get Alzheimer’s 25 Years Ago. Why Hasn’t He?
item.description: Scientists are searching for the secret in Doug Whitney’s biology that has protected him from dementia, hoping it could lead to ways to treat or preve...

item.title: Fifth Third Bancorp is buying Comerica for $10.9 billion in an all-stock deal that will create the 9th largest U.S. bank
item.description: The buyout will create the 9th largest U.S. bank with approximately $288 billion in assets, the companies said Monday.

item.title: France’s Energy Giant Sees Opportunity in the Volatile Electricity Market
item.description: Hoping to help grid operators adapt to changes buffeting the power markets, TotalEnergies is assembling a portfolio of battery farms and natural-gas-f...

item.title: Witkoff and Kushner Expected to Join Israel-Hamas Talks
item.description: Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, both architects of President Trump’s plan to end the war, are expected to join mediation efforts between Israel and H...

item.title: Nobel Prize in Physics Is Awarded for Work in Quantum Mechanics
item.description: John Clarke, Michel H. Devoret and John M. Martinis were recognized for work that made principles of the subatomic realm observable at a larger scale.

item.title: Meet John Ternus, the 50-year-old Apple executive and former swimming champ who’s rumored to succeed Tim Cook as CEO
item.description: Apple is in the midst of a major leadership shakeup, where many senior executives are reportedly set to depart.

item.title: American distilled spirits are becoming a high-profile target for retaliation amid a costly cold shoulder from Canada
item.description: The majority of Canadian provinces continue to ban American spirits from shelves, despite Canada removing its retaliatory tariff on the products weeks...

item.title: Social media trend turns tragic in NYC as ‘subway surfing’ claims lives
item.description: Six people died surfing subway trains in the city last year, up from five in 2023.

item.title: Eric Adams’s Exit From the NYC Mayoral Race Isn’t Having a Major Effect on Cuomo’s Bid So Far
item.description: There has been little evidence that Mayor Eric Adams’s decision to end his re-election bid has had a major effect on Andrew Cuomo’s bid to attract don...

item.title: What People in Gaza Told Us About Two Years of War
item.description: In the two years since Hamas militants attacked Israel, we’ve interviewed more than 700 people in Gaza. Their stories stayed with us. So we tried to f...

item.title: Witkoff and Kushner Expected to Join Israel-Hamas Talks

item.title: Mayor-Elect in Critical Condition After Stabbing in Western Germany
item.description: Iris Stalzer, the incoming mayor of Herdecke, was found stabbed in her home, officials said. It was initially unclear whether it had been a targeted a...

item.title: Pope Leo to Visit Lebanon and Turkey
item.description: The choice signals that Pope Leo XIV aims to press for peace in the Middle East and show support for Christians in the region.

item.title: Map: 6.6-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Papua New Guinea
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.
